body: If anyone builds this, I would also suggest making it possible to deploy models to Google's Cloud Run service.  We are deploying models using this service today and are very happy with it.
Is anyone working on this on Databricks' side? This is the primary feature holding me back before I can fully depend on MLflow.
My use-case for this would be to something akin to mlflow.sagemaker.deploy to use with Google AI Platform.

Hi all, apologies for the delay - we're working on making model deployment pluggable (@hhsecond is driving the effort in #2274), which should make it possible to write a plugin for deploying to GCP - thanks for raising this & we'll keep you posted!

Edit: also feel free to chime in on #2274 or follow along there for updates

Create a guide about it, let me know if this helps or you are looking into a deeper integration. https://medium.com/@gogasca_/building-ml-pipelines-for-tensorflow-in-google-cloud-ai-platform-using-mlflow-38ef4c23acf0

@gogasca awesome! BTW, note that we've actually released a plugin API for model deployment to remote targets - see guidelines [here](https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/plugins.html#writing-your-own-mlflow-plugins) for writing a new plugin, a [dummy example plugin](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/tests/resources/mlflow-test-plugin/mlflow_test_plugin/fake_deployment_plugin.py), and the user-facing API / example usage [here](https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/python_api/mlflow.deployments.html#mlflow.deployments.get_deploy_client). We'd be happy to document a plugin for deployment to GCP on mlflow.org!

If anyone's interested in writing such a plugin, let me know & we can collaborate on the design - we did some super high-level investigation of what deployment to GCP might look like in the [design doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KsyYO82OtHPEV4Uq8_ukDyZdBfgt7EuCtE2zFSQVea4/edit#heading=h.meupc7tyg8fr) for the plugin interface. I'll copy-paste it below for reference:

GCP AI platform
* Deployment flow is to create a model (analogous to MLflow RegisteredModel), then a model version under that (analogous to MLflow ModelVersion, contains actual model source).
* Can update both [models](https://cloud.google.com/ai-platform/prediction/docs/reference/rest/v1/projects.models/patch) (edit description etc) & [patch a model version’s description](https://cloud.google.com/sdk/gcloud/reference/ai-platform/versions/update) etc. 
* [Make predictions](https://cloud.google.com/sdk/gcloud/reference/ai-platform/predict) by hitting a REST API with name of model & model version
* For deployment plugin, would probably map operations as follows:
  * `create_deployment`: Create model with specified name & a model version, return the model name as ID. Assume there’s only ever one version for the model.
  * `update_deployment`: Either update the single version for the model (list versions, get the first one), or create a new version under the same model, set it as default, then delete existing one.
@smurching thanks for the details, I will be interested in working on this. More than happy to sync up next week.
@gogasca awesome, that'd be great! I'll reach out to you over open-source Slack (let me know if there's a better way) to set up time to discuss :)
Hi @smurching @gogasca - are either of you actively working on this plugin?

Hey guys ! 

We've work on a terraform script to deploy mlflow tracking server with only one command on gcp: https://github.com/artefactory/one-click-mlflow

It's actually deployed using app engine with IAP SSO, cloud sql for metrics, and google cloud storage for arrifacts. We're planning to migrate from app engine to cloud run as soon as IAP is available with cloud run in order to reduce costs. 

Deploying models will be the next step, I'm happy to discuss about it and get feedback !

This issue looks like it used to be focused on Google Cloud Run, but I'm interested in deploying using GCP AI Platform's [custom container](https://cloud.google.com/ai-platform/prediction/docs/use-custom-container) functionality which looks to be more closely aligned with MLflow's existing [azure](https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/python_api/mlflow.azureml.html) and [sagemaker](https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/python_api/mlflow.sagemaker.html) deployment methods. Are there plans to support deployment on GCP AI Platform? If not, I'm happy to file an issue.

Here is an early version for Vertex AI (the next iteration of GCP's AI Platform) to deploy via a container.  We are following the (relatively) newer MLFlow plug-in guidelines.

https://github.com/Ark-kun/google_cloud_mlflow
https://pypi.org/project/google-cloud-mlflow/ .

> Hey guys !
>

>

Nice project. Thank you. We are waiting for the cloud run version :)
@griseau any update on the cloud run version? Is IAP still not available?
